cheatsheet.title: Create a new columns comprision analysis

intro.description: This type of analysis enables you to better explore the quality of data and the relationship between tables through comparing identical columns in tables or comparing tables themselves.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata
item.description: This step opens the Create New Analysis wizard. You can right click on the "Analysis" folder or on a column (or click the link below). This wizard helps you to fill the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description....). At the end it opens the corresponding editor in which you can define the settings of the analysis.

item.title: Select columns for the A set
item.description: Click the "Analyzed Column Sets" hyperlink (or click the link below). Then click "Select columns for set A" to open a dialog box where you can select the first set of columns.

item.title: Select columns for the B set
item.description: Click the "Analyzed Column Sets" hyperlink (or click the link below). Then click "Select columns for set B" to open a dialog box where you can select the second set of columns.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: To execute the analysis, click on the "Run" button at the bottom of the editor (or click the link below). You can run the analysis with a context menu on the "Analysis" object in the "DQ Repository" view.
